definition: flat/level/equal/to tie (make the same score)/to draw (score)/calm/peaceful/see also 平聲|平声[ping2 sheng1]

sentences.english: It is the customer's responsibility to close out hedges if they wish to do so.
sentences.chinese: 这是客户的责任来将锁单平仓，如果他们愿意这么做。

sentences.english: A term used by many brokerages to represent the closing of a short position in option transactions.
sentences.chinese: 在期权交易中有许多经纪人使用的买进来平仓。

sentences.english: Market turnover remained low, coinciding with a reduction in open interest in futures.
sentences.chinese: 市场交投仍然稀疏，未平仓期货合约亦见减少。

sentences.english: Wheat was the downside leader, finding profit-taking and technical selling.
sentences.chinese: 由于获利平仓和技术性卖盘，小麦是领跌品种。

sentences.english: But trading volume and the amount of open positions are at the stage of low.
sentences.chinese: 但成交量和未平仓量都处于阶段性低位。

sentences.english: The cash profit from liquidating a position.
sentences.chinese: 指因平仓而获得的现金利润。

sentences.english: When the government steps in, the ever-normal granary becomes in fact an ever-political granary.
sentences.chinese: 当政府介入之后，常平仓贮其实成了政治仓贮。

sentences.english: Rumors that short hedgers were forced to cover short positions also helped rally prices.
sentences.chinese: 有传言说空头被迫平仓也推动玉米期价上涨。

sentences.english: The Liquidation Value represents the cash amount you would have if you have closed all your positions.
sentences.chinese: 清算值显示您将所有头寸平仓后将会得到的现金。

definition: stop-loss point, a point at which you make a small loss to limit your losses
to take an inventory of stock/to clear out one's stock
to agree to pay compensation/to accept liability
to immobilize with a lasso/to be trapped in the stock market
